content.description: <math alttext="N a 2 C O 3 aqueous, plus 2 H C l aqueous, reacts to produce, 2 N a C l aqueous, plus H 2 O liquid, plus C O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>â†’</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: A student combined two colorless aqueous solutions. One of the solutions contained <math alttext="N a 2 C O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as the solute, and the other contained <math alttext="H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The chemical reaction that took place is represented by the equation above. What experimental result would be evidence that a chemical reaction took place when the solutions were combined?

choices.label: Bubbles formed when the two solutions were combined.
The total volume of the mixture is close to the sum of the initial volumes.

content.answer: Bubbles formed when the two solutions were combined.

skill.text: 2.B: Formulate a hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
